content: Yes, the Department of Homeland Security has been actively using privacy-enhancing technologies to protect national security while upholding individuals' privacy rights. These technologies help to minimize the personal data collected by DHS, allowing them to focus on identifying high-risk travelers and potential national security threats. At the same time, the use of these technologies also helps to address privacy concerns by ensuring that personal data is handled with care and only used for legitimate national security purposes. It is important to strike the right balance between privacy and security, and the DHS is taking steps to ensure that both are addressed in a comprehensive and responsible manner.
